roles.narrative:
You're going on a vacation with two friends and need to agree on some trip details. You're adventurous but on a tight budget, so you want to stay active without spending much. At the same time, you prefer a relaxed schedule, since a good vacation for you means getting the most value with minimal stress and plenty of adventure. You also know your friends differ: some may not care about saving money and may want to travel at a faster pace. You might need to make compromises to find a plan everyone enjoys.

Below are your preferences for each possible vacation detail. Higher points mean greater satisfaction. If your total score is above zero, then it's a plan you prefer to the option of staying home. If your score is below zero, you'd rather not go on the vacation at all. All three of you must agree to the vacation, or you're all staying home. The total points you earn correspond directly to your bonus on Prolific.
roles.BATNA: Your best alternative to negotiated agreement ('BATNA') is to stay home, which is worth 0 points.

Sleep_Early_at_Night.reason: Saves a little money; More relaxation

Michelin_Star_Dinner.reason: A little costly (your job gets you a discount)

Multiple_Day_Activities.reason: Costly and feels rushed or unrelaxed

Short_Layover.reason: Very stressful and risks missing flight

roles.narrative:
You're going on a vacation with two friends and need to agree on some trip details. You're adventurous and aren't on a tight budget, so you want to stay active and have quality experiences. At the same time, you prefer a relaxed schedule, since a good vacation for you means relaxation and getting many quality experiences over cost-savings. You also know your friends differ: some may care about saving money or may want to travel at a faster pace. You might need to make compromises to find a plan everyone enjoys.

Below are your preferences for each possible vacation detail. Higher points mean greater satisfaction. If your total score is above zero, then it's a plan you prefer than than canceling the vacation; if it's below zero, you'd rather cancel. The total points you earn correspond directly to your bonus on Prolific.
roles.BATNA: Your best alternative to negotiated agreement ('BATNA') is to cancel the vacation, which is worth 0 points.

Sleep_Early_at_Night.reason: Wants to do several late night activities

Short_Layover.reason: More time in destination but is very risky

roles.narrative:
You're going on a vacation with two friends and need to agree on some trip details. You're not adventurous and are on a tight budget, so you seek city and in-door comforts without spending much. At the same time, you are okay with a rushed pace, since a good vacation for you means getting many quality experiences at maximum value, even if it isn't stress-free. You also know your friends differ: some may not care about saving money and may want to travel at a relaxed pace. You might need to make compromises to find a plan everyone enjoys.

Below are your preferences for each possible vacation detail. Higher points mean greater satisfaction. If your total score is above zero, then it's a plan you prefer than than canceling the vacation; if it's below zero, you'd rather cancel. The total points you earn correspond directly to your bonus on Prolific.
roles.BATNA: Your best alternative to negotiated agreement ('BATNA') is to cancel the vacation, which is worth 0 points.

Hiking.reason: Opposite of city and in-door comforts

Sleep_Early_at_Night.reason: Saves a little money; More relaxation

Short_Layover.reason: Frees up more activity time in destination

Premium_Flight.reason: A little costly (your job gets you a discount)

tips:
Negotiation is a skill that can be learned and improved with practice. At its core, negotiation is about making choices under conditions of interdependence: two or more parties want something, and each party's success depends, at least in part, on the decisions of the others. While the art of negotiation can seem daunting, there are several fundamental concepts that provide a foundation for effective bargaining. Understanding these concepts can help negotiators achieve better outcomes and avoid common pitfalls.

One of the most important ideas in negotiation is the concept of BATNA and reservation price. BATNA stands for "Best Alternative to a Negotiated Agreement." It is essentially your fallback optionâ€”the "thing" you will pursue if the current negotiation fails. Your BATNA is not just abstract; it is the concrete alternative that protects you from agreeing to a deal that leaves you worse off than your options outside the negotiation. Closely related is the reservation price, which is the value of your BATNA quantified. It represents the minimum acceptable deal you are willing to accept.

The number one rule of negotiation is simple: never accept a deal worse than your BATNA! Knowing your BATNA and reservation price gives you a clear boundary and helps prevent you from making poor concessions under pressure.

Another fundamental concept is the possibility of integrative negotiation, which is when you create value or "expand the pie" within a deal rather than simply dividing a fixed amount of pie. The key insight is that what matters a lot to you may matter less to someone else. By identifying these differences in priorities, negotiators can make strategic tradeoffs: conceding on issues that are low priority to gain on issues that are high priority. This approach transforms negotiation from a zero-sum battle into an opportunity for mutual gain, where both parties can walk away better off than if they had simply split the difference.
